title: Impossible reorg, please file an issue
body:
filing an issue as demanded by the log. Happening with my goerli node.

```
ligi@ligi-w520:~$ geth --datadir .goerli/ --goerli 
INFO [03-19|18:25:31.721] Maximum peer count                       ETH=25 LES=0 total=25
```

maybe related: #19258 #16641

I'm currently on mobile so I can't look at this atm.  Can you tell me if the problem persists when you disable fast sync?

@ligi did you by any chance exit unclean earlier, e.g. due to out of disk?

`oldnum=229696 oldhash=e4a6c8…05366e newnum=229696 newhash=e4a6c8…05366e`

So this looks like the edge case where two sealers generate blocks at the exact same time is being reached here.

> @ligi did you by any chance exit unclean earlier, e.g. due to out of disk?

yes - actually there was such an incident (spontaneous shutdown of the machine) - did not correlate the 2 events as this node is starting in the background and I did not check after the incident - but they could correlate

We've noticed a similar behavior when our goerli signer went out of disk. I think the last block only gets written partially to disk and than messes up things. We need to figure out what we can do to recover from this scenario (and shut geth down on OOD).
~~There is a WAL no?  Should be possible to recover from that upon startup.~~  Wait a sec.. I'm not entirely sure LDB supports this...
Managed to trace down the issue, will be fixed by #19544.
